publication/title: Imputation method for single-cell RNA-seq data using neural topic model
dataset/availability: Most of the data are in the NCBI Public Dataset.
dataset/provenance: Human Pancreatic Islet data and Mouse Pancreatic Islet data;Human brain scRNA-seq data.All datasets have been used in other published journals and are available in public dataset repositories
evaluation/availability: Yes.We will publish it on GitHub
evaluation/confidence: Not able to use indicator confidence intervals
evaluation/measure: ARI-Adjusted Rand Index, RI-Rand Index, NMI-Normalized Mutual Information, MI-Mutual Information and so on.
model/duration: Transfer learning of models is linearly correlated with the number of genes
model/interpretability: Transparent.Neural Topic inherit the advantages of the topic model and is highly interpretable
optimization/config: Yes.We will publish it on GitHub
optimization/features: The expression of each gene in a single cell
optimization/meta: No other data were used as inputs
publication/authors: Yueyang Qi, Shuangkai Han, Lin Tang, Lin Liu

publication/title: Imputation Methods for Single-Cell RNA-seq Data Using Neural Topic Models
dataset/availability: NCBI Public Dataset. . All data are available at GEO, with human brain data access number: GSE67835; Chung et al. dataset accession code: GSE75688; Hrvatin dataset GEO accession code: GSE59739; Romanov et al. dataset GEO accession code: GSE74672; Deng et al. dataset GEO accession code: GSE45719; mouse pancreatic islet data GEO accession code: GSE84133. Human pancreatic islet data are available at GEO or EMBL-EBI database with accession codes GSE81076, GSE85241, GSE86469, E-MTAB-5061, and GSE84133.
evaluation/availability: Yes.We will publish it on GitHub
evaluation/measure: ARI-Adjusted Rand Index, RI-Rand Index, NMI-Normalized Mutual Information, MI-Mutual Information
model/interpretability: Transparent.Neural Topic inherit the advantages of the topic model and is highly interpretable
optimization/config: Yes.We will publish it on GitHub
optimization/features: The expression of each gene in a single cell
